title: sftp serve fails due to ssh-rsa deprecation
body:
**What is the problem you are having with rclone?**

OpenSSH has [deprecated the ssh-rsa](https://www.openssh.com/txt/release-8.8) algorithm, hence the command below fails. [A solution has been found as discussed here](https://forum.rclone.org/t/ssh-rsa-deprecated/26839/7), but this bug should get properly fixed.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

v1.56.2

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Arch Linux 64bit

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

b2

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`$ rclone serve -vv sftp b2: --user user --pass test --addr 127.0.0.1:2020`

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
<7>DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.56.2" starting with parameters ["rclone" "serve" "-vv" "sftp" "b2:" "--user" "user" "--pass" "test" "--addr" "127.0.0.1:2020"]
<7>DEBUG : rclone: systemd logging support activated
<7>DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "b2:"
<7>DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/user/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
<7>DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "b2decrypted:"
<6>INFO  : Encrypted drive 'b2:': poll-interval is not supported by this remote
<5>NOTICE: Loaded 2 authorized keys from "/home/user/.ssh/authorized_keys"
<7>DEBUG : Loaded private key from "/home/user/.cache/rclone/serve-sftp/id_rsa"
<5>NOTICE: SFTP server listening on 127.0.0.1:2020
<3>ERROR : serve sftp 127.0.0.1:43030->127.0.0.1:2020: SSH login failed: ssh: no common algorithm for host key; client offered: [ecdsa-sha2-nistp256-cert-v01@openssh.com ecdsa-sha2-nistp256 ssh-ed25519-cert-v01@openssh.com ecdsa-sha2-nistp384-cert-v01@openssh.com ecdsa-sha2-nistp521-cert-v01@openssh.com sk-ssh-ed25519-cert-v01@openssh.com sk-ecdsa-sha2-nistp256-cert-v01@openssh.com rsa-sha2-512-cert-v01@openssh.com rsa-sha2-256-cert-v01@openssh.com ssh-ed25519 ecdsa-sha2-nistp384 ecdsa-sha2-nistp521 sk-ssh-ed25519@openssh.com sk-ecdsa-sha2-nistp256@openssh.com rsa-sha2-512 rsa-sha2-256], server offered: [ssh-rsa]
```

**Log from sftp**
```
$ sftp -P 2020 user@127.0.0.1
Unable to negotiate with 127.0.0.1 port 2020: no matching host key type found. Their offer: ssh-rsa
Connection closed.
Connection closed
```
